DataElement.preferredName: Patient Interval Prior Last Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates whether or not the interval since the last prior radiation therapy meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Interval Prior Last Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences._Earlier in time or order._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Interval Prior Last Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.:Earlier in time or order.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: A minimum of four weeks must
ReferenceDocuments.description: A minimum of four weeks must have elapsed since the completion of the most recent course of radiation therapy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received treatment for primary, non-metastatic NPC, including definitive radiotherapy (RT) and/or induction, concurrent, or adjuvant chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received treatment for non-recurrent, non-metastatic NPC, including definitive radiotherapy (RT) and/or induction, concurrent, or adjuvant chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 3 weeks elapsed since radiotherapy, but at least 6 weeks if CNS or lung fields, with the exception that there is no time restriction for palliative radiation with minimal bone marrow involvement and the subject has measurable/evaluable disease outside the radiation port or the site of radiation has documented progression?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.14 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002739. ak
